cards.flavor_text:
[i]“They feed off dust found in the paths, transforming it into mana. My question is, where does the dust come from?”
—Melodia[/i]
[i]“I've a whip, a map, and a whole hell of a lot of determination. You?”[/i]
[i]“I gotta say, Drakes do make for pretty good mounts.”[/i]

[i]“We understand the forces we tap into. Pray we don't show you.”
—Zoslera, Mordel Clanleader[/i]

[i]“It spins!!! In order to destroy magical weavings, it unfolds itself, by spinning of all things!”
—Melodia[/i]
[i]“They always say the abyss stares back. Often neglected is how beautiful that stare really is.”[/i]
cards.notes:
v1.2 Tap target creature. Put a stun counter on it.
You may discard a card. If you do, draw a card from your sanctum.

v1.1 Tap target creature. You may put a stun counter on it.

cards.flavor_text: [i]“See that rift old friend? That's our destination.”[/i]
[i]With the paths open, there was nothing left to do but explore them.[/i]
cards.special_text: This card can start in your sanctum.

cards.flavor_text: [i]“I will help you seek the beings whose blood can corrupt a world, but I will not allow you to lead them here. Now, sit with me Melodia, and travel the paths with your spirit.”[/i]
[i]Encroaching on other's freedom to explore is punishable by losing yours.[/i]
[i]Cydina's storms proved more intense than Aubrey could handle.[/i]
[i]They go where no one else is brave enough.[/i]
[i]Deep in Shurei's waterways lie a fish that eat anything and everything.[/i]
[i]The draconic mutations caused by the paths leaking in still couldn't separate the two of them.[/i]
[i]“I saw what couldn't be seen, and in an instant I understood what I thought was impossible to understand.”[/i]
[i]Deep in the paths, a magic unknown to Vinimroth manifested in Melodia.[/i]
cards.notes:
!exportname When Words Dont Work
can possibly hit enchantments
Manifest

cards.flavor_text: [i]While most explored the planes connected through the paths due to the god's decree, others chose to follow a path that gave them the freedom to explore their own strengths.[/i]
[i]“Finally! A magic mirror that'll show my true beauty!”[/i]
[i]The report was grim but clear. Marie was stronger now than when they first encountered her. The endless dead proved that.[/i]
[i]“This path is collapsing! I'll stop what I can but we need to move!”[/i]
[i]You always look better in the mirror.[/i]

cards.notes:
CG16,Noncreature,3,,Blinding Fog

Put a land card from your hand or sanctum onto the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“A while back, I met a peculiar creature deep in the outlands. I wonder, does it remember me?”
—Melodia[/i]

cards.notes:
!related Drake Token;
!exportname Cerise Auger of Flow

cards.flavor_text: [i]Few outside of Vinimroth understand just how close sanctums and realms are.[/i]
[i]Discovering the truth of the moon temporarily left the party speechless.[/i]
[i]The mirror of the mirror was perfect in every way, with all its flaws and fortunes for all to see.[/i]
[i]One born to land, one born to sky.[/i]
[i]“Every so often, we sat under the night sky, me and chirps. I wish we did it more often.” —Najael[/i]
[i]Splitting a soul is worth the order it brings.[/i]
[i]Traveling through the paths requires a good aim and even better recon.[/i]
[i]“If the criminal cannot survive the punishment, clearly they were in the wrong!” “Your honor that's solid gold-” “IF THEY SURVIVE-”[/i]
[i]“All we could get back was his head!” Julia exclaimed. “And that's all we need to get out of this maze!” Responded Najael.[/i]
[i]To play in the shadows, you must first escape the light.[/i]

cards.card_name: I Shall Survive in Some Form

cards.flavor_text: [i]These creatures are adapted to the vast towers and decaying structures of their plane.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Pathbound—Exile a silver card from your hand. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Silver spells you cast cost {1} less to cast. 
Whenever you cast a silver spell, surveil 1. [i](Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.)[/i]

Pathbound—Sacrifice a token [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Flash; Flying
When Lost Forest Spirit enters, blank target creature until end of turn. [i](It loses all abilities.)[/i]

Pathbound—Exile all other cards in your sanctum. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Discard your hand, then draw two cards. For each nonland card discarded this way, create a 1/1 red Elemental creature token.

cards.flavor_text:
[i]Her struggle meant nothing to the stars.
—Soros, “Lost From Life”[/i]
[i]So many options, yet only one solution.[/i]

cards.notes:
"Giant Soldier of Stone."
—Giant Soldier of Stone, the Giant Soldier of Stone

cards.flavor_text: [i]After the discovery of silver mana, Multaph sought out icons who could attune to it.[/i]
[i]They get each other worked up into a frenzy over fact and figures, unaware of how off the numbers really are.[/i]
cards.notes:
!gold
!noborder

Once each turn, whenever you tap a Field for mana, add one mana of any color that land could produce.
Fields you control enter the battlefield untapped.

cards.flavor_text: [i]It's in you. It is you. We are you.[/i]
[i]As the gods stood in front of their worshippers, the crowd began to realize the malice made for them.[/i]
[i]They sit in the bounds between worlds, stuck separating its stitches.[/i]
